alert.note: Alert for Burney Basin, Eastern Shasta County; Motherlode; Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley; Shasta Lake Area, Northern Shasta County; West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 02 at 1:40PM PST until March 05 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Winter weather returns to Sierra Late Thursday through Saturday... .A weather system will move through California late week, bringing light Valley rain and mountain snow back to NorCal. The system will start warm, so snow will be confined to above pass level late Thursday. A colder wave will move in Friday bringing more snow, cooler temperatures and lowering snow levels. Those with travel plans to the mountains Friday afternoon and evening should plan for moderate snow showers and lowering snow levels, causing commute issues heading up to the mountains. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON FRIDAY TO 1 PM PST SATURDAY ABOVE 2500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected with lowering snow levels. Plan on slippery road conditions with moderate snow showers during the afternoon and evening commute on Friday. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches, with localized amounts up to 13 inches, are expected. * WHERE...The higher Sierra Foothills and Sierra Nevada of northern California, including I-80 and US-50 passes. * WHEN...Noon Friday to 1 PM Saturday. Heaviest snow is expected between 4 PM Friday and 1 AM Saturday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for increased commute times on I-80 and US-50 Friday afternoon and evening. There will also be reduced visibilities at times with moderate snow showers. Snow levels will be lowering to 1500 feet by Saturday morning, so light accumulations on grassy surfaces will be possible. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will cause primarily travel difficulties. Be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
